page.title: 11St.Giles CofE Primary School
page.content: The school has 72 pupils in three classes.The main building is Victorian and consists of one large room plus a smaller room used as an office.The older children from 9-11 years are in this building.The old school house is now a dining-room,kitchen and stock-rooms.Two demountable classrooms hold the other two classes,the infants from 5-7 years and the lower juniors from 7-9 years.Annual activities in the school include the district sports,cross country running, gymnastics competition,swimming gala, music and folk dance festivals. In school a Christmas concert,harvest festival and various Parent Teacher Association activities are held.This year the P.T.A. held a "Highland Fling" in honour of their chairman,a Scot,Dr.Alan Symington.The school colours are green and gold.
